title: Ask HN: What is the most memorable sentence you read in 2022?
text:
It's the year end and we have our usual flurry of best-books-you-read lists. How about the best sentence(s)? Some of my favorites are ones that pack in a lot, are many-layered, and yet economical with words. Here's my favorite:

"To reliably capture 3 kilowatt-­hours’ worth of fuel requires knowledge, wit, skill, and persistence — ­plus considerable help from your friends. H. sapiens occupies every niche — ­but always with company." - from the book "What is Health?" by Peter Sterling

What are your favorites?

Apple Music Sing: a second look
text: I've been singing along with popular music for a long time, and when Apple Music Sing was initially released recently I discovered that many of my favorite songs apparently aren't so popular after all, because they weren't supported by the service. In the short weeks that followed though, it appears that Apple has been aggressively expanding the Sing catalogue, and I am thoroughly impressed. To my ears the beat is generally a little heavy when lowering the volume of the vocals, but considering the versatility of the vocals volume slider, I give it a solid A-.

What software that you use daily “sparks joy” for you?
text:
Based on the "Kon Mari Method", where you clean your apartment by inspecting everything you own and intuitively judging whether or not it "sparks joy", which of your applications fit that feeling?

For me, it's software like: - Neovim - Zig - Alacritty - Reaper - Obsidian
